pt.ua.dicoogle.sdk.settings

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.ua.dicoogle.sdk.settings.Utils

  • public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper for parsing form input values and creating HTML content based on them, server side.

        public Utils()

    • Method Detail

      • processAdvancedSettings

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> processAdvancedSettings(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> originalSettings,
                                                                                           java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> newSettings)
        This converts and applies the new textual values into the originalSettings HashMap, taking into account their original class/type. Only the settings that exist on both Maps are updated, this avoid invalid settings and Class type injections from happening.
        Parameters:
        originalSettings - the original advanced/internal settings of a plugin or service.
        newSettings - the new settings to apply.
        Returns:
        the originalSettings HashMap with the new values in place (you can use the reference passed as originalSettings instead if you want, they will allways be the same).

      • parseCheckBoxValue

        public static boolean parseCheckBoxValue(java.lang.String value)
        Given the string value of a checkbox obtained from an http request, returns its boolean value.
        Parameters:
        value - the checkbox value obtained from an http request.
        Returns:
        the checkbox state in boolean form.

      • parseCheckBoxValue

        public static boolean parseCheckBoxValue(java.lang.String[] values,
                                         int index)
        Given the string value of a checkbox obtained from an http request, returns its boolean value.
        Parameters:
        values - an array of Strings where the checkbox value obtained from an http request is.
        index - the index on the array where the wanted checkbox value is.
        Returns:
        the checkbox state in boolean form.

      • getHTMLElementIDFromString

        public static java.lang.String getHTMLElementIDFromString(java.lang.String input)
        Based on a input String, returns a valid HTML element name or ID for it. NOTE: be aware that repeated calls with the same input String will return the same result, so, on these cases name/ID collisions will happen!
        Parameters:
        input - the input String.
        Returns:
        a valid HTML element ID or name.

      • getHTMLInputFromType

        public static java.lang.String getHTMLInputFromType(java.lang.String name,
                                                    java.lang.Object value,
                                                    boolean isArrayElement)
        Based on the "real" type/class of the plugin setting Object returns the appropriate form input for it.
        Parameters:
        name - the Form Name of this HTML input.
        value - a Object.
        isArrayElement - if this value Object is part of a another multiple value Object.
        Returns:
        the appropriate form input for the supplied Object.

      • getHTMLInputFromType

        public static java.lang.String getHTMLInputFromType(java.lang.String id,
                                                    java.lang.Object value)
        Based on the "real" type/class of the plugin setting Object returns the appropriate form input for it. This procedure espects the value Object to not be a part of a another multiple value Object.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID and Name of this HTML input.
        value - a Object.
        Returns:
        the appropriate form input for the supplied Object.

      • convertStringValueIntoProperType

        public static java.lang.Object convertStringValueIntoProperType(java.lang.Object originalValue,
                                                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> params,
                                                                int index,
                                                                java.lang.String htmlElementID)
        Converts a String value into the type/class of originalValue.
        Parameters:
        originalValue - the original/target type/class of the value.
        newValue - the new value in String form.
        Returns:
        a new Object of the same class as orignalValue but it's value updated to newValue.
